intro: Solanum subsessile, commonly known as the small-leaved nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or purple, and it produces small, round berries that are toxic to humans and animals. The plant is often found in dry, open habitats and is characterized by its short peduncles, giving it its specific epithet "subsessile."
